p: In the case of the white rose, different dynamics are observed in the ingredients, from a typical citronellol [ 65] to a categorically geraniol model [ 16]. This is probably due to variability in the population itself [ 66]. In summary, the level of terpene alcohols approaches that of R. damascena Mill. Geraniol is known to carry pharmacological effects in rose oil [ 67, 68]. A low content of methyleugenol and a high content of geraniol guarantees safe application with proven biological effects of R. alba L. essential oil.
